content: the hem the border is worked back and forth joining to the hem with a slip_stitch at the end of each right side row the right side will form the outside of the border and the wrong side will be the inside of the border after the seventh chain chain 1 as a turning chain you will now be working back towards the hem starting in the chain second from the hook single us double uk crochet single_crochet in each chain 7 stitches slip_stitch into the hem in the second stitch along from where the chain was joined turn the work and single_crochet into the back loop only scblo of each of the single crochets from the row below 7 single crochets repeat the following two row until the hem reaches the corner of the front panel finishing on a wrong side row right side row chain 1 turning chain scblo 7 slip_stitch into second hem stitch from the previous row wrong side row scblo 7 i added a mitre at each of the two corners at the bottom of the front panels this allows the border to sit flat starting from the right side row 1 ch1 turning chain scblo 5 row 2 skip the first stitch scblo into the remaining 4 stitches row 3 ch1 turning chain scblo 3 row 4 skip the first stitch scblo into the remaining 2 stitches row 5 ch1 turning chain scblo 4 place the last stitches anywhere convenient row 6 skip the first stitch scblo into the remaining 3 stitches row 7 chain 1 turning chain scblo 6 place the last stitches anywhere convenient row 8 skip the first stitch scblo into the remaining 5 stitches page 11 recipe for a granny square cardigan by insertinnergeek designs return to the 2 row pattern working up the side of the right front panel this forms the button band add button holes as required as you work this part of the border i added the button holes by chaining 2 or 3 stitches depending on the size of the button where i want the hole to be and skipping the same number of stitches then continuing with the scblo pattern continue the border with the two row pattern up an around the edge of the hood and back down the edge of the left front panel until you reach the corner at the bottom of the panel add the 8 row mitred corner as before then continue the 2 row pattern along the bottom hem when you reach the centre of the bottom hem where you began the border finish with a right side row and join the two edges of the border together in the same manner as the cuffs step 10 finishing weave in any remaining ends and sew on your buttons depending on your yarn you may wish to block the cardigan this is my finished item page 12
